title: WATCH: Did Doncaster's equaliser against Shrewsbury cross the line?
description: Shrewsbury manager Paul Hurst says he has not seen any evidence that Doncasterâ€™s equalising 'goal' crossed the line in a 2-2 draw at New Meadow.
content:
In the week that video assistant refereeing hit the headlines, Hurst will have been cursing the technology isn't readily available in Sky Bet League One.
Despite carrying a two-goal lead past the hour mark at New Meadow, the Shrews were pegged back when substitute Mathieu Baudry headed home, before Issam Ben Khemis' left-wing cross-cum-shot was adjudged to have crossed the line despite the best efforts of 'keeper Dean Henderson.
Both of Henderson's feet had crossed the line, but, from the referee's position, it is incredibly difficult to be sure the ball also crossed the line.
So did Ben Khemis' effort cross the line? Click on the video above to make your mind up...
